block.p: Chestnuts are not often seen in their well-armored husks, but the Eckerton Hill Farm stall at the Union Square Greenmarket has them on Mondays and Wednesdays. Chestnut trees mostly succumbed to blight early in the 20th century. Tim Stark, however, owner of the farm, which is in Pennsylvania, is one of the few who still have healthy trees. His fresh, unroasted chestnuts are $4 a pound. Alex Lee, the executive chef at Daniel, finds them sweeter than Italian chestnuts and says they can be frozen.
